titleStmt.title: Letter, James L. Dodds overseas, to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Apr. 12

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, James L. Dodds overseas, to Ellen Smith in Jackson, Tenn.,1918 Apr. 12

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Will write you a few lines this P.M. I am getting along fine and have been all the way over except I was Sea Sick a few days.
But I am most over now and just the thoughts of land once more makes me feel good I dont like this water though not so murch at a time
Say I got your letter after I had got on the boat But I guess I wont get any more soon
But you must write to me as often as you can and tell me all the news I cant tell you
where I am or what I am doing so you see I wont have murch to write about But I will write you as often as I can I dont know where we will land but I have an idea it will be some where in France

Well its not long until Esther wedding day I sure wish I could be there but I will be a long way from home by then Tell her I wish her a long and happy life and I will see her some day when I come back to the good old U.S.
Well I dident get to use the fanesthe I.C. sent me But I still have them any way
Well I know you are good for
Mis and Mrs Jones to come back to Jaxon so you will have some one to stay with you
Well Ellen I dont know any thing else to write but if I was there I could talk for a week Now dont wait for me to write before you do you write me real often and I will write when I can
Say Orr got his watch just before we left Maryland
Will close for this time will write you when I land
